content: As a Male Puritan living in the Massachusetts Bay Colony in 1632, I would likely be married and have a wife. Marriage and family were highly valued in Puritan society, and it was considered a religious duty for men and women to marry and have children. The relationship between husband and wife would be based on mutual respect, love and devotion, and would be considered a partnership in the eyes of God. The couple would work together to provide for the family, raise children, and fulfill their religious obligations. The relationship would be strong and grounded in shared values and beliefs.
